content.description:
Due to this route being Ice/Alpine, isn't really a crux out of the ordinary. It is a vertical route, and at the top is the typical ledge to climb over to ascend to the top. Following the hiking trail from the road, this route is (if I recall correctly) the second or third set of ice you will see along the wall. If you follow the path, it should lead you directly to the base. There are options to either set up anchors from above, or lead the route.

For leading, beginners may want to bring about 8 screws, more experienced can send it with less.

To set up a top rope, there is much natural anchors at the top, many of which have webbing already set up. According to locals, those are left by the local climbing instructor and are replaced regularly, but you can use at your own discretion.

P1 - Climb the 75-80 degree ice to belay just before the steeper pillars 
 P2 - climb the steep pillars 
 P3 - Continue to the trees above

Screw/Tree belay. Rappel the route.

pathTokens: LAKE SUPERIOR E: Sault St. Marie to Marathon, includes Montreal River Harbor and Agawa Canyon

content.description:
There are quite a few climbs around Montreal River. 
  
 On the East side of the road, most climbs are on South facing walls, all of which are quite secluded, with a fair amount of shade, along with quite spectacular views of the Montreal river (when you can get a view of it, since these are deep in the woods).
